info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 04 at 7:45PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Schenectady, southeastern Fulton and southeastern Montgomery Counties through 845 PM EDT... At 745 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Gloversville, moving south at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Amsterdam, Gloversville, Johnstown, Fonda, Broadalbin, Hagaman, Mayfield, Fort Johnson, Tribes Hill, Perth, Glen, Berkshire, Charleston, Fultonville, Bleecker, Meco, West Perth, Munsonville, Church Corners and Rockwell Corners. This includes Interstate 90 between exits 27 and 28. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
